verbose_text: Studies on the mechanism underlying the neuroprotective action of CPE-NFalpha1 using rat primary hippocampal neurons in culture revealed that when these cells were stressed with H 2 O 2, it activated the ERK and AKT signaling pathways, presumably by binding to a cognate receptor, which then up-regulated expression of Bcl2, a pro survival mitochondrial protein, and down-regulated expression of Caspase 3 to mediate neuroprotection (see XREF_FIG).
